entries.title: Canada’s New Guidelines for Alcohol Say ‘No Amount’ Is Healthy
entries.description: The guidance builds on growing evidence, after decades of sometimes conflicting research, that even small amounts of alcohol can have serious health consequences.

entries.title: At Wartime Davos Forum, Calls for European Unity Are Eased by Relief
entries.description: “Our energy supply for this winter is secure,” Germany’s chancellor declared as government and business leaders gathered at the World Economic Forum.

entries.title: Russian Officials Denounce Aleksei Navalny’s Treatment in Prison
entries.description: Their open letter to President Vladimir V. Putin is the latest in a series of public appeals from within Russia, despite his crackdown on dissent.

entries.title: The Only H.I.V. Vaccine in Advanced Trials Has Failed. What Now?
entries.description: Janssen Pharmaceuticals ended a global trial after independent experts determined the vaccine was not effective. But there are other possibilities in the pipeline, scientists said.

entries.title: Your Thursday Briefing: A Deadly Helicopter Crash in Ukraine
entries.description: Also, why economists are alarmed about China’s demographic crisis.

entries.title: Russian Citizen Accused of Running Cryptocurrency Exchange Used by Criminals
entries.description: The charges were part of an intensifying effort by federal law enforcement agencies, in conjunction with European partners, to combat international cryptocurrency schemes and illegal transactions.

entries.title: U.S. Warms to Helping Ukraine Target Crimea
entries.description: The Biden administration is considering the argument that Kyiv needs the power to strike at the Ukrainian peninsula annexed by Russia in 2014.

entries.title: The Power Politics of Social Change
entries.description: From civil rights and apartheid to the protest movements of today.

entries.title: ‘Tragedies are outpacing life’: In a video address at Davos, Zelensky mourns the dead and pleads for help.
entries.description: At the start of his address, the Ukrainian president called for a minute of silence to honor the country’s minister of internal affairs.

entries.title: A French City Appeals to Madonna for Clues About a Long-Lost Painting
entries.description: The painting “Diana and Endymion” disappeared from Amiens, France, more than a century ago. The city’s mayor says Madonna could hold a key to the mystery, but experts say the pop icon has nothing to do with it.

entries.title: Israel’s Supreme Court Blocks Appointment of Netanyahu Minister
entries.description: The court ruled that Aryeh Deri, a close ally of Benjamin Netanyahu who was convicted of tax fraud, should be removed from his posts, setting up a clash between the government and the judiciary.

entries.title: Sister André, World’s Oldest Known Person, Dies at 118
entries.description: The French nun had lived through two world wars and the 1918 flu pandemic. She survived Covid and was said to enjoy a daily dose of wine and chocolate.

entries.title: Tinkering with tape, a scale and a 3-D printer, one Ukrainian unit is on a quest to build the perfect grenade.
China’s Self-inflicted Pain
entries.description: China’s rise seemed inevitable, but now it’s hitting serious roadblocks.

entries.title: Helicopter Crash in Ukraine Kills at Least 18, Including Cabinet Official
entries.description: It was not immediately clear what caused the helicopter crash, near a kindergarten, but there were no initial signs that it had been shot down.

entries.title: Zelensky will address the Davos gathering in a marathon week of diplomacy.
A Shrinking, Aging China May Have Backed Itself Into a Corner
entries.description: A demographics challenge has been building for years, but Beijing’s preparations are lagging. Now, many worry that current measures may offer too little, too late.

entries.title: Ukraine Minister Killed in Helicopter Crash Oversaw Some Security Forces
entries.description: Denys Monastyrsky was the highest-ranking Ukrainian government official to die since Russia’s invasion began in February last year.

entries.title: Why China’s Shrinking Population Is Cause for Alarm
entries.description: China struggled for years to curtail its rapid population growth. Now that its population is declining, economists and others fear serious implications for China and countries around the world.

entries.title: Renting as a Single Woman in India: No Visitors, No Drinking, Home by 9
entries.description: India says it must do more to harness women’s economic potential. A good place to start, many say, would be the many obstacles they face outside the workplace.

entries.title: Your Wednesday Briefing
entries.description: China puts on a brave face at Davos.

entries.title: Untested German Defense Minister Has Allies Watching Closely
entries.description: Boris Pistorius, the new defense minister, is seen as a skilled politician but, entering a world stage on which Ukraine is at war, he may pose a risk for Chancellor Olaf Scholz.

entries.title: Maria Ressa, Philippine Journalist, Is Acquitted of Tax Evasion
entries.description: The verdict was a rare legal victory for Ms. Ressa, founder of the news site Rappler, who has been under pressure from the Philippine authorities for years.
